alert.note: Alert for Jack; Wise (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 21 at 7:26PM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Wise and eastern Jack Counties through 800 PM CST... At 726 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Graford, or 11 miles south of Jacksboro, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bridgeport, Jacksboro, Alvord, Chico, Paradise, Boonsville, Cottondale, Runaway Bay and Lake Bridgeport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CST for north central Texas.
